lines.text: How do you fair on the road?
On charity. What is the custom of charity in this town? In silence or aloud?
Those who beg in silence starve in silence.
I beg as the master begged. Even as he went, so do I.
When a colt is born to be a polo pony, I think it would be a crime to bind him to a heavy cart.
He who travels alone travels fastest.
But not as safely.

[Noticing that Hurree Chunder has noticed a pretty girl driving by]
The sky is the same color wherever you go.
Well done, friend of all the world, well done.
Gratitude is good for the ear, but a rupee is better for the stomach.
One day you'll make a great trader.

[With urgency]
Down! Keep down! The night is full of eyes!
But for this meeting, your head would be full of holes.

[Talking to the Russians about Kim]
Leave him to me. We have our own way of loosening a tongue.

[to Kim]
You belong with your own people. A true man, like a true horse, runs with his own breed.

[to the letter writer]
What manner of inquisitive goat are you? Thy mother was married under a basket and thy father was a sweeper of the stables.

[as they are about to cross a stream, Kim spots a cobra on a rock]
No, holy one, don't go there. See - a cobra, king cobra!

[Kim picks up a large stone to kill it]
No, let him live out his life! He's bound on the wheel of life as we are. Great evil this soul must have done to be reborn in this shape!
Be careful, Mahbub Ali.

[With bravado]
Mahbub Ali does not die tonight.
